Content.Question: The function of long-term scheduler is to:
Content.A: Move the process from ready queue to CPU.
Content.B: Move the process from memory to secondary storage.
Content.C: Move the process from secondary storage to ready queue.
Content.D: Move the process between different queues.

Content.Question: The full form of PCB is:
The ready queue is maintained by __________.
What is the function of mid-term scheduler?
Content.A: It moves the process from ready queue to CPU.
Content.B: It helps the CPU in executing the process.
Content.C: It swaps out the idle process from memory to secondary storage.
Content.D: It moves the process between different queues.

Content.Question: The processes are executed in the following manner in Round Robin Algorithm.
Content.A: The process having the smallest burst time is executed first.
Content.B: The process is executed for a time quantum and when the time quantum expires, the process enters into waiting state.
Content.C: The processes are executed according to their priority.
Content.D: The process coming first is executed first without preemption.

Content.Question: Which of the following is not the function of Operating System?
Which of the following in not an Operating System?
The state of a process is stored in its __________.
What is the function of short-term scheduler?
Content.A: Selects a process from memory and swaps out to secondary storage.
Content.B: Selects a process from I/O queue to moves it to ready queue.
Content.C: Selects a process from secondary storage device and allocates it to the CPU.
Content.D: Selects a process from ready queue and assigns it to the CPU.

Content.Question: Which of the following is not a product of Microsoft?
Which system tools is used to migrate file?
Which of the following is not an operating system?
What is the difference between a clean installation and an upgrade?
Content.A: There is no difference; they are the same.
Content.B: A clean install includes applications and settings from previous installations.
Content.C: An upgrade includes applications and settings from previous installations.
Content.D: A clean installation starts by formatting the hard drive.

Content.Question: What does an unattended installation require?
Which of these operating system is not Unix based ?
Given the following directory permissions:drwxrwxrwt  14 root  36864  2012-03-02  11:17  tmp. What is the letter t at the end of drwxrwxrwt  indicate?
Content.A: It is a temporary bit that prevents launching commands in this directory
Content.B: It means that even though the directory is global writable only the owner can delete their own files
Content.C: It makes the directory accessible for everybody
Content.D: It is the sticky bit that causes all commands in this directory to be launched as a root.

Content.B: A group can only have one main user
Content.C: There can be only one user group on a system
Content.D: Every user belongs at least to one user group
